reviews.review_text: This is not a 5 star lodge but the people deserve 5 star rating. Clean corridors affordable and comfortable room for a single per as well as for a family looking for short stay. I have spent a week here and it is is secure and at a point where you can access the twin cities conveniently in all directions.
Only Location is good. Rooms are smelly and not that clean. Cockroaches were also spotted in the rooms. Guests kill them and clean the room.
Highly recommended. Was polite stuff and better rooms with affordable prices
Staff behaviour is nice but its rooms are small in size.

The bedsheets were too dirty even stains were visible
Washrooms are so much in bad condition
Not worth staying

Had to stay one night in this place. There are some hotels around better than this with same price. Its better to look for other hotels. It is really not worth it.

Not the best place to stay long. Paid 2500 for one night, the washroom was quite literally untouchable and useless. The walls were paper thin so you could hear random people moving about and coughing. The bedsheets weren't even clean. Wifi was the only thing that was working fine. 2500 PKR for 12 hours is unjustifiable.

I booked and confirmed this place through Agoda, arriving at nearly 7pm. When I got to the reception desk, they informed me that they don‚Äôt accommodate foreigners and that my booking never existed. Being rejected at the reception desk like this was infuriating. If you don‚Äôt accept foreigners, don‚Äôt list your property on platforms like Agoda or Booking.com, or at the very least, clearly state it in the description in capital letters.

This was a deeply frustrating and disappointing experience, especially after a long journey. Not the welcome I expected for my trip to Islamabad, and it left a bad first impression. Such poor communication and service.
